review.title: Marginalizing in Undirected Graph and Hypergraph Models
review.abstract: Given an undirected graph G or hypergraph X model for a given set of variables V, we introduce two marginalization operators for obtaining the undirected graph GA or hypergraph HA associated with a given subset A c V such that the marginal distribution of A factorizes according to GA or HA, respectively. Finally, we illustrate the method by its application to some practical examples. With them we show that hypergraph models allow defining a finer factorization or performing a more precise conditional independence analysis than undirected graph models.

sections.text: In many practical situations the structural relation between a series of variables V = {V1,.., Vn} can be represented as an undirected graph g = (V, E), where there are a series of edges of g. If two variables are independent of each other, the corresponding nodes should not be connected by a path. Likewise, if the independence between the variables X and Y is indirect and by a third variable Z (that is, if X and Y are conditionally independent), we show Z as a node that intersects the path between X and Y, i. e, Z is a cutset between the variables X and Y.
